name: Ping Sweep (Live Hosts)
description: Find live hosts quickly in a subnet (no port scan).
sample_output:
Nmap scan report for 10.0.0.12
Host is up (0.0031s latency).
Nmap scan report for 10.0.0.20
Host is up (0.0019s latency).
Nmap done: 256 IP addresses (2 hosts up) scanned in 2.34 seconds
soc_notes: Look for unusual sweep activity (many ICMP echo requests).
Correlate with firewall/IDS logs for scan source, time window, and subnet scope.

name: Top Ports Scan (Fast Baseline)
description: Quick baseline of common ports and services.
sample_output:
PORT     STATE SERVICE  VERSION
22/tcp   open  ssh      OpenSSH 8.2p1
80/tcp   open  http     nginx 1.18.0
443/tcp  open  ssl/http nginx 1.18.0
Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results.
soc_notes: Use results to validate asset inventory and expected services.
Alert if new services appear unexpectedly.

name: Full TCP Port Scan (Exposure Check)
description: Thorough check of all TCP ports (slower, noisier).
sample_output:
Not shown fully (65,535 ports checked)
PORT      STATE SERVICE
135/tcp   open  msrpc
445/tcp   open  microsoft-ds
3389/tcp  open  ms-wbt-server
soc_notes: High-volume SYNs across many ports are usually detectable.
Coordinate a change window for production.

name: TLS / SSL Checks (HTTPS Posture)
description: Identify TLS ciphers and certificate details.
sample_output:
| ssl-cert: Subject: commonName=example.local
| Issuer: commonName=Example CA
| Not valid before: 2025-01-01
|_Not valid after:  2026-01-01
| ssl-enum-ciphers:
|   TLSv1.2:
|     ciphers:
|       TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (secp256r1) - A
|_  least strength: A
soc_notes: Certificate anomalies can indicate misconfiguration or MITM.

name: SMB Exposure & Enum (Windows)
description: Detect SMB and gather safe metadata using scripts.
sample_output:
| smb-os-discovery:
|   OS: Windows Server 2019
|   Computer name: FILESRV01
|_  System time: 2025-12-19T19:01:22+00:00
| smb2-security-mode:
|   2.02:
|_    Message signing enabled and required
soc_notes: External SMB exposure is high risk; verify segmentation.
Watch for repeated script probes across many hosts.

name: DNS Zone Transfer Test
description: Check if a DNS server allows AXFR (misconfiguration).
sample_output:
| dns-zone-transfer:
|   domain: example.com
|   AXFR: failed (REFUSED)
|_  Refusal is expected / secure behavior
soc_notes: If AXFR succeeds, treat as sensitive exposure.
Restrict transfers to authorized secondaries only.
